resource.name: All City Funds
resource.description:
Current balances of all Funds for the City of Los Angeles. Includes General Fund, Reserve Fund, Budget Stabilization Fund, and Special Funds. Upated daily, Monday through Friday.

For figures pertaining to Fiscal Year 2018, view the "All City Funds - FY18" dataset at https://controllerdata.lacity.org/dataset/All-City-Funds-FY18/9wxw-98tn/data.
columns_description: Cash Balance

Funds with a schedule number have revenue and expenditure budgets reviewed and approved by the Mayor and City Council. Funds without a schedule number are considered "off-budget" since their budgets are not reviewed and approved by the Mayor and City Council.

resource.name: City Revenue
resource.description: City revenue including adopted, amended, budgeted and revenue collected since fiscal year 2012. Data is updated monthly.
columns_description: Fiscal year (FY) is a period that a company or government uses for accounting purposes and preparing financial statements.
Source of City revenue.
Name of a City Department, Bureau or Office in the City of Los Angeles.

resource.name: City Employee Payroll (Current)
resource.description: Payroll information for all Los Angeles City Employees including the City's three proprietary departments: Water and Power, Airports and Harbor. Data is updated bi-weekly by the Los Angeles City Controller's Office. Payroll information for employees of the Department of Water and Power is updated every three months.
columns_description: Any payments other than Regular and Overtime. This includes bonuses, adjustments, and lump sum payouts. Examples of bonuses include Permanent, Longevity, and Temporary Bonuses. Lump Sum Pay includes significant one-time payouts due to retirement, lawsuit settlements, or other adjustments.
Job Title
Regular work hours payment
Payments attributable to hours worked beyond regular work schedule
City contribution for the employee's health care, dental care, vision care, and life insurance

Department Number in City Payroll System

resource.name: City Employee Payroll (2013-2018)
resource.description:
Note this dataset is no longer being updated. Please use the updated payroll dataset with current pay year information: https://controllerdata.lacity.org/Payroll/City-Employee-Payroll-Current-/g9h8-fvhu.

Payroll information for all Los Angeles City Employees including the City's three proprietary departments: Water and Power, Airports and Harbor. Data is updated on a quarterly basis by the Los Angeles City Controller's Office. Payroll information for employees of the Department of Water and Power is provided by the Department.

resource.name: Idle Funds
resource.description: Idle Funds are Los Angeles City funds with no expenditures since June 30, 2014, as identified by LA Controller Ron Galperin.
resource.attribution: City of Los Angeles - Office of the Controller

resource.name: Every Animal Counts
resource.description: City Controller Ron Galperin released an audit that indicated the Los Angeles’ Department of Animal Services is making progress toward its goal of making Los Angeles a “No Kill” City. Still, last year about one of every four lost or abandoned animals that entered the City’s shelters were euthanized. View the department's raw data on each of the City's six animal shelters below.

resource.name: Idle Funds
resource.description: Idle Funds are Los Angeles City funds with no expenditures since June 30, 2014, as identified by LA Controller Ron Galperin.
resource.attribution: City of Los Angeles - Office of the Controller

resource.name: Financial Reports & Documents
resource.description: A repository of financial documents, statements and reports relating to all aspects of City operations.

resource.name: City Budget and Expenditures
resource.description: City Budget, Adjustments and Expenditures since Budget Fiscal Year 2012. Financial data is shown by Budget Fiscal Year.

resource.name: Food Resources in California
resource.description: This dataset contains a list of resources such food pantries, food banks, and other food distribution sites throughout the state of California. The data is current as of May 1, 2020. Due to the coronavirus pandemic, many food pantries may change their hours or close temporarily. Please contact a food pantry prior to visiting them to confirm their operating hours and ensure you are in their service area.

resource.name: DWP Audits
resource.description: A database of audits completed by the Internal Audit section of the Department of Water and Power (DWP). These audits are not validated or verified by the Controller's Internal Audit Division, and represent the work of auditors directly employed by the DWP.

resource.name: Debt Cap
resource.description: Provides the total debt cap and approved debt percentage.
resource.attribution: Office of the Controller - City of Los Angeles

resource.name: City of Los Angeles Economic Data
resource.description: Comprehensive economic data for the City of Los Angeles. Prepared by Beacon Economics.

resource.name: 30 Year Revenue Breakdown
resource.description: A comprehensive look at the City's Revenues by department, revenue source, and category over the bast 30 years.
